javadoc:
High-level abstraction associated with a low level function made up of assembly instructions.
 Based on information the decompiler has produced after working on a function.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: function
params.comment: function associated with the higher level function abstraction.

params.name: language
params.comment: description of the processor language of the function

params.name: compilerSpec
params.comment: description of the compiler that produced the function

params.name: showNamespace
params.comment: true signals to print function names with their namespace

methods.javadoc: @return get the associated low level function
methods.name: getFunction

return.comment: get the associated low level function

methods.javadoc: @return get the language parser used to disassemble
methods.name: getLanguage

return.comment: get the language parser used to disassemble

methods.javadoc: @return the function prototype for the function (how things are passed/returned)
methods.name: getFunctionPrototype

return.comment: the function prototype for the function (how things are passed/returned)

methods.javadoc: @return an array of jump table definitions found for this function decompilation
methods.name: getJumpTables

return.comment: an array of jump table definitions found for this function decompilation

methods.javadoc: @return the local variable map describing the defined local variables
methods.name: getLocalSymbolMap

return.comment: the local variable map describing the defined local variables

methods.name: grabFromFunction
methods.comment:
Populate the information for the HighFunction from the information in the
 Function object.

params.name: overrideExtrapop
params.comment: is the value to use if extrapop is overridden

params.name: includeDefaultNames
params.comment: is true if default symbol names should be considered locked

params.name: doOverride
params.comment: is true if extrapop is overridden

methods.javadoc:
Check the symbol space for objects that indicate specific overrides to decompiler analysis:
      a) switch flow
methods.name: grabOverrides
methods.comment:
Check the symbol space for objects that indicate specific overrides to decompiler analysis:
      a) switch flow

methods.name: readJumpTableListXML
methods.comment: Read in the Jump Table list for this function from XML

methods.name: splitOutMergeGroup
methods.comment:
If a HighVariable consists of more than one (forced) merge group, split out the group
 that contains vn as a separate HighVariable. Otherwise just return the original high.

params.name: vn
params.comment: is a representative of the merge group to split out

throws.comment: if the split can't be performed

return.comment: a HighVariable containing just the forced merge group of vn

methods.name: buildFunctionXML
methods.comment:
Build an XML string that represents all the information about this HighFunction. The
 size describes how many bytes starting from the entry point are used by the function, but
 this doesn't need to be strictly accurate as it is only used to associate the function with
 addresses near its entry point.

params.name: entryPoint
params.comment: pass null to use the function entryPoint, pass an address to force an entry point

params.name: size
params.comment: describes how many bytes the function occupies as code

methods.name: buildFunctionShellXML
methods.comment:
Build the XML representation of only the shell function info not including everything known
 about the function.

params.name: addr
params.comment: address the function is located at

methods.name: stringTree
methods.comment:
Create XML parse tree from an input XML string

 TODO: this probably doesn't belong here.

params.name: xml
params.comment: is the XML string to parse

params.name: handler
params.comment: is the handler to use for parsing errors

throws.comment: for format errors in the XML

methods.name: tagFindExclude

params.name: tagname
params.comment: -- Name of tag to search for

params.name: doc
params.comment: -- String through which to search for tags

return.comment: all characters between beginning and ending XML tags, excluding tags themselves

name: HighFunction
comment:
High-level abstraction associated with a low level function made up of assembly instructions.
 Based on information the decompiler has produced after working on a function.
